definition: to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass

to monopolize/to take on responsibility over everything/to undertake the whole task
all-inclusive/undiscriminating
to attract (customers)/to drum up (trade)
to contract for an entire project
to monopolize
to assume full responsibility/to be in full control/to monopolize
to take complete charge (idiom)
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
to reach for the stars (idiom)
to win the support of/to get over to one's side/to keep control of
to canvas (for customers)/to solicit/to advertise/to drum up/sales pitch/to take on (a task)
to canvas for lawsuits (idiom); to practice chicanery

sentences.english: The company boasts a lot of awards it received at international fairs.
sentences.chinese: 該公司在國際性會展上一舉攬獲數項大獎。

sentences.english: Can I have a look at that set of cloisonne ?
sentences.chinese: 我看看那套靜態攬瓷器好麼？

sentences.english: Eric had the luck to have close body contact with his female fans when they were playing games.
sentences.chinese: 孫耀威與女歌迷玩遊戲時又搭膊頭又攬腰，豔福不淺。

sentences.english: Iraq and the bosom embrace me, except I preexistence is frivolous.
sentences.chinese: 伊，攬我之懷，除我前世輕浮。

sentences.english: To quote Spider - Man's late uncle : "With great power comes great responsibility."
sentences.chinese: 正如蜘蛛俠的最新名言“攬大權者擔重任。”

sentences.english: You're lucky that I've held this up for you.
sentences.chinese: 你很幸福，因爲我把一切都攬下了。

sentences.english: She went to the trouble of shortening the trousers for her younger brother.
sentences.chinese: 她自動攬下了把她弟弟的褲子改小的任務。

sentences.english: Instead, put the burden on yourself.
sentences.chinese: 反之，要把責任攬在你自己身上。

sentences.english: Hug her from behind when sleeping with her enfolded and feeling like a baby.
sentences.chinese: 從背後抱着她睡覺，像孩子一樣攬在懷裏。

sentences.english: He rides up on a big stallion, sweeps her into his arms.
sentences.chinese: 他騎着一匹健壯的牡馬衝上去，將她攬在懷中。
